channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - HP Hero
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2018 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: In one week, the President has taken almost every possible Republican position on immigration
item.description: President Donald Trump has taken almost every possible Republican position on immigration in the span of a week as he's tried to deal with the crisis he created of separating thousands of children from their parents at the border.

item.title: Rubio heckled after touring shelter
See inside immigration detention center
item.description: CNN's Brian Todd travels to Bristol, Virginia, for a rare look inside a detention facility for unaccompanied immigrant minors.

item.title: Analysis: 8 minutes of audio changed the debate
item.description: The sounds are unmistakable: Children sobbing. Hard. Begging to be allowed to see their parents, their aunt, a relative. And then crying again when told that isn't possible.

item.title: Poppy Harlow responds to Trump's tweet
item.description: CNN's Poppy Harlow responds to President Trump who described recent accounts of separated families at the border as "phony stories."

item.title: Trump admin says 500 families reunified
item.description: The Trump administration said Friday that it had reunified approximately 500 families separated at the border but the status of thousands more separated families remained unclear.

item.title: Dem: Trump order is 'unconstitutional'
item.description: President Donald Trump's executive order to keep undocumented immigrant parents and children together is "unconstitutional" and did not solve the family separation issue, Rep. David Cicilline said Friday.

item.title: DNA reveals a WWII veteran stole an 8-year-old's identity
item.description: He was a WWII veteran with a Purple Heart, a wife and three children. But in 1964, he vanished, moved across the country and later took the identity of an 8-year-old boy who had died years before.

item.title: 5 anti-trafficking activists gang-raped in India, police say
item.description: Five female anti-trafficking activists were gang-raped in the eastern Indian state of Jharkhand, police said Friday, the same region where two teens were raped and then set on fire last month.

item.title: Top Netflix exec out after racial slurs
item.description: A top Netflix executive has left the company after he used the N-word in front of colleagues on more than one occasion.

item.title: 9,000 barrels of bourbon fall in Kentucky distillery collapse
item.description: Pardon bourbon lovers for crying in their beer after half of the barrels being aged at a Kentucky distillery building fell to the ground when part of the structure collapsed.

item.title: Bodies found in Colombia may be those of missing journalists
item.description: Authorities in Colombia and Ecuador are working to determine if bodies discovered Thursday are of an Ecuadorian press team abducted along the Colombian border with Ecuador.

item.title: Former cheerleaders suing NFL team
item.description: Six former NFL cheerleaders are suing the Houston Texans for alleged harassment and unfair pay practices. The lawsuit is being brought by prominent attorney Gloria Allred.

item.title: Take that, US. Europe's tariffs take effect
Source: Lasers target US aircraft over Pacific
item.description: Lasers have been used to target US aerial operations in the Pacific, with 20 incidents recorded since September of last year, according to a US military official.

item.title: Here's how NASA plans to stop asteroids
item.description: NASA's new five-step plan will help scientists detect near-Earth objects they haven't been able to find before.

item.title: Analysis: There's nearly a '74 level of support to impeach
item.description: There is a truly remarkable number in the most recent CNN poll, conducted by SSRS and out this morning.

item.title: Opinion: Impeachment fever bad for Dems
item.description: According to a new CNN poll conducted by the SSRS, a stunning 42% of Americans believe that President Trump should be impeached and removed from office -- close to the 43% who felt the same way about President Richard Nixon during the climactic months of Watergate in March of 1974. The percentage is far higher than the 29% who said in 1998 that they favored President Clinton being impeached.

item.title: Analysis: An utterly disastrous week for Donald Trump
item.description: Fresh off one of the best -- or, at the very least, most consequential -- weeks of his presidency, Donald Trump just experienced one of his worst weeks in the White House.

item.title: Analysis: Melania Trump's 'I really don't care. Do U?' jacket was no mistake
item.description: As she boarded a plane to head to McAllen, Texas, for a surprise visit to the heart of the family separation crisis at the southern border, Melania Trump was spotted wearing a coat with these words scrawled on the back: "I really don't care. Do U?"

item.title: Showdown when lawmaker refuses to stop playing crying kids audio
item.description: Democratic Rep. Ted Lieu (D-CA) played the audio recording of immigrant children crying after being separated from their families.

item.title: EPA makes coins for 2017 responders
item.description: The Environmental Protection Agency is spending more than $8,500 on challenge coins to congratulate its response to 2017 natural disasters, including the hurricanes that ravaged Texas and Puerto Rico. CNN's Sara Ganim reports.

item.title: Planned Parenthood sues HHS over teen pregnancy program
item.description: Planned Parenthood is suing the Department of Health and Human Services over changes to the agency's embattled Teen Pregnancy Prevention Program.

item.title: White House donates canceled picnic food to military hospital
item.description: Perishable food from the canceled congressional picnic was donated to Walter Reed National Military Medical Center, the first lady's spokeswoman Stephanie Grisham confirmed Friday.

item.title: Chinese food all-you-can-eat deal goes very wrong
Chipotle is adding a bunch of items to its menu
NBA Rookie of the Year odds released
Former Superman becomes police officer
item.description: Actor Dean Cain, who portrayed Superman in "Lois & Clark: The New Adventures of Superman," was sworn in as a reserve officer by the Idaho State Police.

item.title: Selfies reveal moving facial lump: a parasite
What higher wages mean for Domino's and McD's
Demi Lovato opens up about relapse
item.description: Demi Lovato has released a new single that reveals a heartbreaking setback in her road to recovery from addiction.

item.title: Johnny Depp's Rolling Stone reveal
item.description: Johnny Depp opened up about his legal and personal struggles in recent years during an interview with Rolling Stone magazine.

item.title: Report: NFL to suspend star QB 3 games
Colbert: Was first choice 'womp womp' jacket?
item.description: Late-night hosts make jokes about first lady Melania Trump's wardrobe choice during her trip to the US-Mexico border.

item.title: Forget your 401k if you own a home (do this)
Messi and Argentina owe Nigeria a thank you
Neymar in tears after Brazil's dramatic win
Twitter calls out Neymar's massive dive
Swiss goal breaks Serbia's hearts
This team is biggest surprise of the World Cup
item.description: Perhaps the biggest surprise of FIFA 2018 is the Russian squad. They came in as the lowest ranked team but have outscored their opponents 8:1 so far. CNN's Frederik Pleitgen visits their training center in Novogorsk to talk to some of the star players.

item.title: ABC rolls the dice, again
item.description: ABC rolled the dice on a new version of "Roseanne" with Roseanne Barr, and thanks to the star's unmanageable nature, wound up getting burned. After taking a principled stand by canceling the show because of Barr's racist tweets, the network has opted for another revival --a Roseanne-free "Roseanne," indicating its new priority is simply cutting its losses.

item.title: A 'Roseanne' spinoff is coming -- without Roseanne
NBC cancels sci-fi thriller 'Timeless'
item.description: The clock has run out for sci-fi drama "Timeless" at NBC.

item.title: 'Believer' review: Deeply personal, equally moving
item.description: Deeply personal and equally moving, "Believer" documents Imagine Dragons lead singer Dan Reynolds' crusading campaign on behalf of LGBTQ rights, in direct conflict with the teachings of the Mormon Church under which he was raised.

item.title: The week in 24 photos
item.description: Take a look at 24 photos of the week from June 15 through June 21.

item.title: Newly found extinct ape offers us a warning
Watch how KitKats are made
item.description: Go inside the KitKat factory in Japan to see how the candy is made, including unconventional flavors like cheesecake and wasabi.

item.title: Octavia E. Butler: A visionary among futurists
item.description: Before dystopian fiction like "The Hunger Games" and "Divergent" reflected an increasingly diverse society, there was Octavia E. Butler, one of few African-American authors to become a prominent name in the white-dominated universe of science fiction.

item.title: We took an exclusive ride in a flying car
Thousands of electric scooters are coming to Paris' streets
This tech can literally make it rain
Let XXXTentacion's death be the end of his fame
Would James Madison have used his cell phone in here?
item.description: James Madison never had a cell phone -- not even a flip phone! But the Supreme Court is frequently called on to conjure what Madison and the other framers of the Constitution might have made of our world, one very different from the one they knew.

item.title: The Supreme Court just rocked the internet
Putin's ultimate World Cup chess move
I wasn't in a cage, but was scarred for life
You could save thousands in interest by doing this
2018's Best CD's
4 cards to have you flying in no time
What's the average age when kids get a social media account?
ICE detainee diagnosed with chickenpox
item.description: An immigrant detained at a federal prison in California has been diagnosed with chickenpox, raising concerns among the prison staff.

item.title: His son's battle with cancer inspired his epic run
Reasons to skip an activated charcoal 'detox'
item.description: On her Goop website, Gwyneth Paltrow claimed that charcoal lemonade was one of the "best juice cleansers". That was in 2014. Today, charcoal products -- from croissants to capsules -- are everywhere. Even high street coffee chains have taken to selling charcoal "shots".

item.title: Pediatrician: Separated children 'trying to find ... anyone to hold on to'
item.description: A pediatrician in Colorado examines young children newly separated from their parents and shares her observations with CNN. She says that while their physical condition was fine, emotionally "they were the opposite of stable."

item.title: Johnny Depp clarifies his pricey wine tab
item.description: If Johnny Depp fans have been feeling curious about the eccentric actor, a new Rolling Stone profile on Depp may give them reason for concern.

item.title: Paul McCartney's new music
item.description: He may have just turned 76, but Paul McCartney is clearly not ready to retire.

item.title: Darren Aronofsky on Anthony Bourdain
item.description: This essay has been edited for grammar and punctuation only.

item.title: The most romantic resorts in the world
item.description: As a 333-island nation in the South Pacific Ocean, Fiji is synonymous with clear waters, technicolor coral reefs and celebrity hideaways.

item.title: Take America's national parks home with you
item.description: The first time Rob Decker visited a national park, he was 6.
